Welcome to

About Us

What we do?

We believe that Virtual Reality is the future of entertainment and human interaction. The VR market is constantly developing, especially in gaming, and in enterprise segments. The tendency goes towards virtual reality becoming mainstream in the near future. But there is still a long way to go.

Our goal is to enrich the virtual reality experience by improving the user’s immersion.

Problem

Unfortunately, VR experiences often cause health-related issues including headaches, eye strain, dizziness, and nausea. Usually, those issues are caused by low frame rate and unnatural image being displayed. In order to increase the frame rate we need more computing power which is very expensive and not accessible to majority of consumers.

Solution

Using state of the art software, infrared LEDs and sensors, we can track human eye movement within the HMD (Head-Mounted Display). This allows us to not only improve the user’s immersion and overall experience, but also drastically reduce the rendering workload. Identifying the exact position of the eye gives us the possibility to:

  • Use Foveated Rendering, a rendering technique which is reducing the image quality in the peripheral vision in order to reduce the GPU usage. In result we can achieve better graphics and higher frame rate using the same hardware.
  • Eliminate or reduce most of the negative side effects which are caused by low frame rate or frame rate dropdowns.
  • Add eye interaction. Use your sight to navigate around the virtual environment, create avatars that can mimic your eye movement for better social interaction, and more.
